inclusion.criterion: sustained monomorphic VT by ECG or ICD interrogation
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: 40 seconds of VT and then bradycardia with a rate of 39 shortly thereafter corresponding with his symptoms

inclusion.criterion: VT burden: 4 or more documented VT episodes in the 5 months preceding enrollment
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: electrocardiographically documented symptomatic, recurrent, sustained monomorphic VT in the 3 months prior to enrollment
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: the patient went into monomorphic VT on telemetry

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: implantation of a cardiac monitoring device

inclusion.criterion: ischemic or non-ischemic cardiomyopathy previously diagnosed with LVEF ≤ 35%
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: antiarrhythmic medication without control of symptoms or with poor toleration
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: the patient does not report any symptoms prior to this episode

inclusion.criterion: ability to understand and willingness to sign an IRB approved informed consent document
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: the patient feels presyncope and nausea, but denies chest pain

inclusion.criterion: EP cardiologist confirmation of study entrance criteria
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: prior radiotherapy to the internal organs of the thorax or upper abdomen
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: multiple scars on electrocardiographic imaging with unclear reentrant focus
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: congestive heart failure on inotropes (NYHA class 4B) or left-ventricular assist device
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: unlikely to live 12 months in the absence of VT
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of CAD, prior MI, HLD, HTN, ventricular tachycardia, and syncope. He was recently discharged after a negative work-up for syncope which included the implantation of a cardiac monitoring device.
